adding.name: splice
adding.desc: The splice() method changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements and/or adding new elements in place.

adding.name: unshift
adding.shortDesc: add elements to the beginning of an array
adding.desc: The unshift() method adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array and returns the new length of the array.

adding.name: push
adding.shortDesc: add elements to the end of an array
adding.desc: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array..

adding.name: concat
adding.shortDesc: add an array to another array
adding.desc: The concat() method is used to merge two or more arrays. This method does not change the existing arrays, but instead returns a new array.

deleting.name: pop
deleting.desc: The pop() method removes the last element from an array and returns that element. This method changes the length of the array.

deleting.name: slice
deleting.desc: The slice() method returns a shallow copy of a portion of an array into a new array object selected from start to end (end not included) where start and end represent the index of items in that array.

deleting.name: shift
deleting.desc: The shift() method removes the first element from an array and returns that removed element. This method changes the length of the array.
